Description: Body sherd of probably Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a lekanis; interior: glazed streaky black (fired red); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of nude male figure squatting frontally, possibly defecating (head, part of torso and right leg missing; red on nipple); at right, boar (part of head, back and lower body missing; with added red on flank) facing left; incised splinter rosette as filling ornament; below, overlapped by figures, fine dilute line and row of dots.
Curator's comments: In many respects the piece appears Attic, but the style is unusual.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.17)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 256, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0759) (Phase 1)
